group_1.textCenter: I was saved by others despite my inner turmoil...@Even amidst my father's passing...
Here and now, I crave fleeting sympathy or@even just feeble encouragement...
(I, too, don't want to face this alone...)
(If only friends, teachers, and family could know@what we're going through
and give us some comfort... Even just a few words@would be totally fine.)

group_1.narration: No...I'm on the verge of tears,@my voice can't help but tremble...

group_1.textLeft: I'll tell you why I asked you to stay.

group_1.textRight: I understand...@My singing was no good...

group_1.textLeft: Not only was your voice too shallow, but you were@also lacking your usual projection.
I had been considering asking you to lead the part,
but with so few days to go before the Festival, it's@going to be tough to keep the show on the road.
That said, as bad as it was, there are other reasons@why I asked you to stay.
Let me ask you straight, Kurusu.@What happened?
Oh, uh, sorry. I don't mean to force it out of you@or anything...
If it's something you don't feel comfortable talking@about, you don't have to tell me about it.
Just don't forget to ask someone for help if you@can't handle it on your own.
I'm part of the teaching staff.
If there's another teacher you'd like to talk to,@I'll let them know.

group_1.textRight: No, it's okay. I'm sorry for worrying you.
Things have been a bit of a shock, and I'm having@a hard time wrapping my mind around it.
But I'm sure I'll find a solution, so you don't need@to be concerned about it.

group_1.textLeft: However, you still have too many lingering anxieties@to be able to lead the other club members.
I think I'll give you the solo part instead,@how about that?
Even if group balance wasn't achieved, your@individual singing is still perfectly fine.
In fact, I believe the turbulence you're carrying@shall empower you to connect with people.
If you say you can do it, then I'll leave it to you.

group_1.textRight: (After all, the one I once had a crush on still@understands me...)
(He's awkward, but in his own awkward way,@he tries to be there for me...)
(With a teacher like that, who understands my@turbulence, I want to tell him...)
(I want to tell him about it, about what I'm@going through...)

group_1.narration: The fact remains unchanged@that we have to keep everything a secret:
The truth that we've become Magical Girls,@the truth that we're fighting Witches,@and the truth that we'll eventually become@Witches ourselves...
